uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class GeoPolygon

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoShape
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoPolygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDReferenced
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeoLine
public class GeoPolygon
extends GeoShape

This class is intended for storing georaphical polygons such as boundry data for wards, costlines etc.

Version:
0.5 17 April 1997
Author:
Jamaes Macgill

toAWTPolygon

public java.awt.Polygon toAWTPolygon()
Returns a standard AWT.Polygon from the GeoPolygon note The GeoPolygon used doubles , the Polygon uses ints so there will be precision loss.

getCentroidLocation

public GeoPoint getCentroidLocation()
Return the centroid of this polygon. this value was either supplied to the constructor or has been calculated automaticaly.
automaticaly calculated centroids are not guaranteed to be inside the polygon, insted they represent the polygons center of mass.
Returns:
GeoPoint The centroid of this polygon
Since:
0.7.7.1 8/May/2000

public double[] getPointsAsArrayY()

dropVector

public void dropVector()
Drop the use of a Vector to store the points. This method is available for performance reasons. You will only want to use this method if you store a lot of GeoPolygons, and you wish to decrease the memory load.

getPoints

public final java.util.Vector getPoints()
Description copied from class: GeoShape
Gets a full list of all the points that make up this shape. For Polygons and rectangles this would be the vertecis, for circles it would be the center point.
Overrides:
getPoints in class GeoShape
Following copied from class: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoShape
Returns:
A Vector of GeoPoints for each point of this shape

equalsIgnoreID

public boolean equalsIgnoreID(GeoPolygon b)

isClockwise

public boolean isClockwise()
Tests to see if the polygon is Clockwise
anti-clockwise polygons often represent holes
this is computed on the fly so might be expensive.
Addapted from C function writen by Paul Bourke.
Returns:
boolean true if polygon is clockwise.

calculateCentroidLocation

protected void calculateCentroidLocation()
Calculates a waighted centroid location for this polygon.
the result is stored in the private member variables xcent and ycent overwriting any values that may already be stored their.
area must be set before calling this method, e.g. a call to calculateArea should have been made during construction.
Polygons must have clockwise point encoding in order to have a centroid, holes (encoded with anti-clockwise points) have undefined behavior at this point. N.B. the centroid will be the 'center of mass' but this is not guaranteed to be inside the polygon.
Since:
0.7.7.1 08/May/2000
See Also:
#calculateArea

isContiguous

public boolean isContiguous(GeoPolygon gp)
Will test the given polygon to see if it is adjacent to this polygon.
This code is somewhat experimental and has not been fully tested.
Parameters:
gp - The GeoPolygon to test for contiguity
Returns:
boolean, true if this polygon and gp share two or more verteces that are consecetive in both polygons

getContiguousLength

public double getContiguousLength(GeoPolygon gp)
Calculates the length of all arcs that are common both to this polygon and to the polygon pased in.
Parameters:
gp - The polygon to measure shared lengths with
This code is somewhat experimental and has not been fully tested.
Returns:
double the total length of all shared arcs between the two polygons, returns as 0 if there are no shared arcs/

areConsecutive

public final boolean areConsecutive(GeoPoint p1,
                                    GeoPoint p2)
Tests the two provied points to see if they apeare next to each other in any of this polygons arcs. The test is regardless of order.
This code is somewhat experimental and has not been fully tested.
Parameters:
p1 - the first point to test
p2 - the second point to test
Returns:
boolean true if p1 follows p2 or p2 follows p1, false in any other case, including p1 and/or p2 being absent from the polygon

getContiguityList

public java.util.Vector getContiguityList(java.util.Vector polys)
Provides a list of all of the polygons from the provided list that are adjacent to this one
This code is somewhat experimental and has not been fully tested.
Parameters:
polys - a Vector of GeoPolgyons to test against for contiguity.
Returns:
Vector a sub set of polys that contains only the polygons that are adjacent to this one.

isOnOutside

public boolean isOnOutside(GeoPoint p1,
                           GeoPoint p2,
                           java.util.Vector polys)
Given the line described by the two points, this method tests to see if it is internal or external with regards to the set of polygons listed in the vector.
p1 and p2 SHOULD be points that are in this polygon.
This code is somewhat experimental and has not been fully tested.
Parameters:
p1 - GeoPoint the first endpoint of the line to test
p2 - GeoPoint the second endpoint of the line to test
polys - A Vector of polygons to test the line agains for inside/outside ness.

isOnOutside

public boolean isOnOutside(java.util.Vector polys)
Tests this polygon to see if contains at least one edge that is on the outside of the set of polygons described in the provided set.
This code is somewhat experimental and has not been fully tested.
Parameters:
polys - A Vector of polygons to test against
boolean - true if any edge of this polygon is not contiguous with any of the polgyons listed in polys

dissolve

public static GeoPolygon dissolve(java.util.Vector polys)

dissolve

public static GeoPolygon dissolve(int id,
                                  java.util.Vector polys)
A static method that will disolve all internal borders within the provided set to create a single polygon which describes the outline of all the given polygons combined.
This code is somewhat experimental and has not been fully tested. in particular, if the polygons do not define a single clump then it will not work as expected.
Parameters:
polys - A Vector of GeoPolgyons to disolve.
an - id for this new polygon.
Returns:
GeoPolygon the disolved version of the polys set.

dissolve

public GeoPolygon dissolve(GeoPolygon gp)
Combines this polygon with the provided polygon to create a new single polygon with the combined outline of both.
both polygons must be contiguous.
Parameters:
gp - the GeoPolygon to disolve into this one.
Returns:
GeoPolygon the resulting disolved polygon.
